Head: Occipital headache and PAIN THROUGH THE GLOBE OF THE EYES and orbits
Pain across the brain from left to right
Pain along right malar bone running to temple
Mind: Great desire to work and to be doing something useful
Chest: Convulsive pains at the heart; feels as if transfixed
Pain in chest through heart, with pain running toward spleen
Pain in left pectoral muscle and cartilage of left lower ribs
Sensation of a great weight on heart, and pricking pain
Difficult, sighing respiration, as from some compression of chest
Extremities: Pain in neck, back, shoulders, down arms, hands and fingers
Pain in knees and joints of lower extremities

name: Cereus bonplandii
Relationship: Compare: Cactus; Spigel.; Kalmia; Cereus serpentinus. (Very irritable with tendency to swear; wild anger and low morals. Disturbance in speech; in writing leaves off the last syllable. Paralyzed feeling. Pains in heart, and dwindling of sexual organs. Emissions, followed by pain in testicles.)
